quote: A clear conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory.
A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.
A conscience without God is like a court without a judge.
A good conscience is a continual feast.
A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
A lot of people mistake a short memory for a clear conscience.
A man who has no conscience, no goodness, does not suffer.
A man who has nothing to do with his own time has no conscience in his intrusion on that of others.
A man's conscience and his judgment is the same thing; and as the judgment, so also the conscience, may be erroneous.
A man's moral conscience is the curse he had to accept from the gods in order to gain from them the right to dream.
A man's vanity tells him what is honor, a man's conscience what is justice.
A peace above all earhtly dignities: A still and quiet conscience.
A clear conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory.
A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.
A conscience without God is like a court without a judge.
A good conscience is a continual feast.
A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
A lot of people mistake a short memory for a clear conscience.
A man who has no conscience, no goodness, does not suffer.
A man who has nothing to do with his own time has no conscience in his intrusion on that of others.
A man's conscience and his judgment is the same thing; and as the judgment, so also the conscience, may be erroneous.
A man's moral conscience is the curse he had to accept from the gods in order to gain from them the right to dream.
A man's vanity tells him what is honor, a man's conscience what is justice.
A peace above all earhtly dignities: A still and quiet conscience.
A Sunday school is a prison in which children do penance for the evil conscience of their parents.
Avoid lawsuits beyond all things; they pervert your conscience, impair your health, and dissipate your property.
By definition, a government has no conscience. Sometimes it has a policy, but nothing more.
Conscience - the only incorruptible thing about us.
Conscience has no more to do with gallantry than it has with politics.
Conscience in most men, is but the anticipation of the opinions of others.
Conscience is a man's compass.
Conscience is a mother-in-law whose visit never ends.
Conscience is but a word that cowards use.
Conscience is our magnetic compass; reason our chart.
Conscience is the inner voice that warns us that someone might be looking.
Conscience is the inner voice which warns us that someone may be looking.
Conscience is the internal perception of the rejection of a particular wish operating within us.
Conscience is the mirror of our souls, which represents the errors of our lives in their full shape.
Conscience is the root of all true courage; if a man would be brave let him obey his conscience.
Conscience is the sentinel of virtue.
Conscience is the voice of the soul; the passions of the body.
Conscience is the window of our spirit, evil is the curtain.
Conscience is thoroughly well-bred and soon leaves off talking to those who do not wish to hear it.
Conscience: self-esteem with a halo.
Conviction is the conscience of the mind.
Courage without conscience is a wild beast.
Forgetfulness. A gift of God bestowed upon debtors in compensation for their destitution of conscience.
Freedom of conscience entails more dangers than authority and despotism.
Give me the liberty to know, to utter, and to argue freely according to conscience, above all liberties.
Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience; this is the ideal life.
Honor is the moral conscience of the great.
I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.
I wasn't driven into medicine by a social conscience but by rampant curiosity.
In many walks of life, a conscience is a more expensive encumbrance than a wife or a carriage.
In matters of conscience, first thoughts are best. In matters of prudence, last thoughts are best.
It is far more important to me to preserve an unblemished conscience than to compass any object however great.
Justice is a temporary thing that must at last come to an end; but the conscience is eternal and will never die.
Love is too young to know what conscience is.
Men never do evil so fully and cheerfully as when we do it out of conscience.
Modesty is the conscience of the body.
Most people sell their souls, and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.
Never do anything against conscience even if the state demands it.
Nobody has any conscience about adding to the improbabilities of a marvelous tale.
Nothing strengthens the judgement and quickens the conscience like individual responsibility.
O conscience, upright and stainless, how bitter a sting to thee is a little fault!
People are getting smarter nowadays; they are letting lawyers, instead of their conscience, be their guide.
Public opinion is a second conscience.
Reason often makes mistakes, but conscience never does.
Religions are the great fairy tales of conscience.
Shame arises from the fear of men, conscience from the fear of God.
The chief prerequisite for a escort is to have a flexible conscience and an inflexible politeness.
The chief requisites for a courtier are a flexible conscience and an inflexible politeness.
The conscience can be a strong guide in life if we allow it.
The conscience is the sacred haven of the liberty of man.
The first and greatest punishment of the sinner is the conscience of sin.
The New England conscience doesn't keep you from doing what you shouldn't - it just keeps you from enjoying it.
The Non-Conformist Conscience makes cowards of us all.
The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
The person that loses their conscience has nothing left worth keeping.
There is no witness so terrible and no accuser so powerful as conscience which dwells within us.
There is one thing alone that stands the brunt of life throughout its length: a quite conscience.
To be conscience that you are ignorant is a great step to knowledge.
To sit alone with my conscience will be judgment enough for me.
Vengeance taken will often tear the heart and torment the conscience.
Virtue is more to be feared than vice, because its excesses are not subject to the regulation of conscience.
We only labor to stuff the memory, and leave the conscience and the understanding unfurnished and void.
What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?
What we call conscience in many instances, is only a wholesome fear of the law.
While conscience is our friend, all is at peace; however once it is offended, farewell to a tranquil mind.
Writing is conscience, scruple, and the farming of our ancestors.
Conscience does make cowards of us all.
